p: The leaves and stems of P. heudelotii had lower total phytosterol contents than cabbage ( Piironen et al., 2003; U.S. Department of Agriculture, 2016a) and lettuce ( Piironen et al., 2003). They had lower sitosterol than cabbage, but higher contents than lettuce ( Piironen et al., 2003) and the leaves of T. procumbens ( Ikewuchi et al., 2015). They also had lower stigmasterol than cabbage, lettuce ( Piironen et al., 2003) and the leaves of T. procumbens ( Ikewuchi et al., 2015). They had lower campesterol than cabbage and lettuce ( Piironen et al., 2003). Their avenasterol contents were lower than that of lettuce ( Piironen et al., 2003).
